date

Class Holidays

  • java.lang.Object
    • date.Holidays

  • public final class Holidays
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility to maintain a reference to standard holidays recognized in the United State of America.
    Holidays maintained are:
    • New Year's Day
    • Martin Luther King Jr. Day
    • President's Day
    • Memorial Day
    • Independence Day
    • Labor Day
    • Colombus Day
    • Veteran's Day
    • Thanksgiving Day
    • Christmas Day
    Since:
    09/15/2019
    Author:
    jacobwatson

    • Method Detail

      • calculateDynamicDate

        public static final java.time.LocalDate calculateDynamicDate(int year,
                                                             java.time.Month month,
                                                             int dayOfWeekInMonth,
                                                             java.time.DayOfWeek dayOfWeek)
        Calculates and determines a dynamic date. A dynamic date here is a date that always falls on the same day of week in a month - regardless of the actual date. Dynamic dates are calculated using the given temporal parameters:
        • Year
        • Month
        • Ordinal day of week (within month)
        • Day of week (Monday, Tuesday, etc.)
        Parameters:
        year - The year this dynamic date takes place.
        month - The month this dynamic date takes place.
        dayOfWeekInMonth - The ordinal day of week within the month. This is used in expressions such as 'the first Monday in September'.
        dayOfWeek - The day of week this date always falls on.
        Returns:
        Returns the dynamic date that has been calculated.

      • getNewYearsDayFor

        public static final java.time.LocalDate getNewYearsDayFor(int year)
        Creates and returns a date that coincides with New Year's day for the given year.

        For any given year, New Year's day falls on the first day of January.
        Parameters:
        year - The year that this New Year's day falls on.
        Returns:
        Returns New Year's day for the given year.
